I can understand your perspective. However, keep in mind that the purpose of the World Cup is not just to determine the best football team in the world. It is also about promoting the sport globally, generating economic activity, and fostering international relationships through sports. Granting the host nation an automatic qualification can help achieve those goals.

Moreover, the host nation's free pass to the World Cup does not necessarily mean that they will have an advantage over the other teams. In many cases, they face tougher opponents, and they might not have played many international matches leading up to the tournament. Additionally, the World Cup is a high-pressure environment, and anything can happen during a match. Therefore, any team, including the host nation, must perform at the highest level to be successful.

Finally, even though the host nation gets an automatic qualification, they still have to prepare and play in the tournament just like any other team. They will have to train, analyze their opponents, develop strategies, and deal with injuries and player selection. Overall, the World Cup is a challenging competition, and the host nation's free pass does not guarantee them success.
